body.name: RAM Mounts X-Grip Holder for 12" Tablets RAM-HOL-UN11U Compatible with RAM B 1" and C 1.5" Size Round Ball Bases , Black
features: Spring-loaded 'X' design with rubber caps sports great holding power without hiding your tablet; fits most 12" tablets
Easy access grip knobs on the back of the holder allow for the quick release of your tablet
Made of powder-coated, marine-grade aluminum, stainless steel components, and high-strength composite for durability and reliability in the most demanding environments

Compatible with 12" Tablets, Apple iPad Pro 12.9 (1st Gen), iPad Pro 12.9 (2nd Gen), iPad Pro 12.9 (3rd Gen), Dell Latitude 5285, Google Pixelbook, HP Pro X2 612 G1, Lenovo Miix 720, Yoga A12, Microsoft Surface Pro (2017), Surface Pro 3, Surface Pro 4, Samsung Galaxy Book 12", Galaxy Pro 12.2, Galaxy TabPro S

Simply Mechanics The RAM X-Grip technology combines simply mechanics with a well-built housing to make this phone holder the last one you will ever need. RAM X-Grip Tether RAM X-Grip phone holders come with an optional safety tether for added peace of mind in harsher environments. RAM X-Grip for Tablets The RAM X-Grip is offered for tablets ranging from a Samsung Tab S7 to iPad Pro 12.9". RAM X-Grip for Phones The RAM X-Grip comes in standard and large for phones of all sizes with or without a case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gotta love RAM!
reviews.reviewText: I'm a pilot and I rely on both a Microsoft Surface and an iPad Air 2 in the cockpit, and I'm happy to say that both work really well in this cradle.I'm also happy to say that the construction quality is very good. I've dropped mine, stuffed it into all sorts of cramped flight bags and generally treated it pretty roughly, and it still looks and works like new. The parts that matter are all metal and strong enough for demanding use. A few of the other brands I've tried might be lighter, but the plastic parts some of them use just never held up well for me.My Surface tends to fit directly in the cradle (I don't use a case), and the iPad fits in the standard Apple leather case (but probably not a thicker case). Both fit well in either portrait or landscape mode and are solid enough to be secure in turbulence - I've yet to have an issue of either tablet popping out of the mount in rough air. I also like that the little clamps remain mostly out of the way - doesn't block the camera, microphone, ports, buttons, etc - although the iPad is somewhat challenging to press the various side buttons.One of the great things about RAM is that you can buy the individual mounting pieces you need to create a custom mount, and you can use the same cradle in many different ways. In one of the planes I fly, there's a 1" ball mounted on the panel and I'm able to connect a short articulating arm to this cradle for a perfect fit. Other aircraft I fly don't have this mounting ball, so I use a RAM suction cup to attach the cradle to the side of the windshield, or one of the RAM clamps to clamp the cradle to the yolk. Very convenient being able to carry a single cradle, yet having all these options.One very small issue is that the back plate tends to be insulating and so my tablets tend to get fairly hot, especially if I leave the cradle in the aircraft on a hot day. A major improvement would be a way to have some sort of small heat sinks on the back of the cradle to help with this, but it's overall a pretty minor issue.This is pretty much the perfect cradle for a larger tablet - definitely worth a look if you need to mount your tablet in any sort of boat, vehicle or airplane.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Still holding strong from abuse of a 9 year old.
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this to hold our 9 year old Fire Tablet (with kid case) in the back seat. It is a tight fit, but once it is in there it does not fall out. We have it attached to the head rest posts with a RAM Mount Clamp and a short extension and it works perfectly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Does not support 12" Samsung Tablets.
reviews.reviewText: As the title says, you can only install one of the two short end supports to hold the larger Samsung Galaxy Tab S8+ Still works and rather sturdy.Make sure to get the 'C' size ball adapters as the smaller 'B' size won't hold the weight.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars iPad user info
reviews.reviewText: I have an iPad 10.2” and 10.9” both in waterproof cases. I use them on my off road atv and sxs. This ram mount x grip holds them both, separately obviously. I bought the mount for the 12” tablet since I have cases on my iPads. It fits. I previously had the ram mount for 10” but my iPads with the case would not fit. Conclusion - if you’re like me and have 10” + size iPads, in a case, buy this model.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Herky, well made, very adjustable

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: As a traveling man, I’ve used a lot of differ t mounting products.HANDS DOWN this company has it figured out.Sturdy, clean materials. Slick appearance. Will be buying some of their other products

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It holds a 12.9” iPad Pro
reviews.reviewText: Got my iPad in an otter box case and it holds it. Got this to attach to my ram mount I was already using. I wanted to get rid of that board and velcro I was using. I expected more from Ram Mount when I ordered this. I was disappointed in it after a day or so after using it. The cheap rubber bumpers they have on these are just that, cheap. No glue or even a bit of tape was included with mine. The bumpers fall off constantly if I’m not careful. I understand I’m technically exceeding the size limit of 12” so that’s why I’m not dropping down to 1 star. On the positive side the holder arms are actually made of metal not plastic. The bumpers push on to them and will need to find some glue to keep them on. Also might need a drop or 2 of WD40 on the inside of the mount. Mine is a bit stiff and sticks when opening up the clamps.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy well built
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for my son for his 12.9 inch fith generation iPad Pro, use the claw mount to hold to his tray, works incredible and he loves it, it may cost a bit more than most mounts but you could tell it is very good quality and would most likely last a lifetime if not many years

reviews.reviewTitle: Qulität super aber paßt nicht für Samsung Galaxy Tab 57+
reviews.reviewText: Die Haltung macht einen Sehr guten Eindruck. Hätte sie gerne behalten, aber die Seitenteile sind zu kurz für mein Samsung Galaxy Tab S7+. Außerdem drücken die Halter genau auf den Lautstärkeschalter wenn man es mittig montiert.
